source_wiki_titles: A Gun in Every Hand, For Now

acts.title: Introducing the Wasteland Wanderer
acts.summary: The protagonist, a lone survivor, emerges from Vault 101 into the post-apocalyptic world of the Capital Wasteland, setting up camp at Megaton.

acts.title: Encountering the Enclave
acts.summary: The protagonist discovers a hidden Enclave facility near the ruins of Washington D.C., leading to an infiltration mission that exposes their presence to local factions like the Brotherhood of Steel.

acts.title: Betrayal and Battle
acts.summary: The protagonist infiltrates the Enclave facility, learning about Project Purity, a plan to desalinate water from the contaminated Potomac River. However, they are caught by the Enclave, leading to a violent confrontation that results in their escape.

acts.title: Repercussions and Retribution
acts.summary: The protagonist deals with the consequences of their actions at the Enclave facility, including the loss of allies and the threat of retaliation from the organization. They must navigate this new landscape of faction tensions and resource scarcity.

acts.title: A New Path Forward
acts.summary: The protagonist decides to support the Brotherhood of Steel's efforts to stop the Enclave, using their knowledge of Project Purity to aid in this goal. They reflect on the harsh realities of survival in the Capital Wasteland and the importance of unity amidst adversity.

acts.title: Setup
source_chunks: Citadel Terminal Entries_G.N.R. Battle After-Action Report_20_47

acts.title: Resolution
source_chunks: Citadel Terminal Entries_G.N.R. Battle After-Action Report_105_132

recent_scripts.content: "Good morning, everyone! This is Julie here at Radio Appalachia. It's 8:00 AM sharp, and a brand new day has dawned on our beloved wasteland. The sun's up, birds are singing - it's time to rise and shine, survivors! Let's make today count for rebuilding and bettering this place we call home. Welcome home, Appalachia."

I'm just happy to be here, playing music for you guys. So, I heard that some folks have been spotting these really big... critters out in the woods lately? Like, super-sized Grahams and Yao and Ghouls! Can you imagine running into one of those on a hike? Someone told me they saw this giant Brahmin with two heads just grazing by a stream. Honestly, it looked kinda cute? In a weird, radioactive way.

Word is these mutations have been getting bolder since the Scorched started to fade away. Maybe they're adapting to the new world order or something. I mean, who knows, right? It's not like we can exactly ask them for an interview! But hey, more wildlife in Appalachia, even if it's a little... unconventional. Guess that's just life out here in the wasteland! Alright, next up, let's groove to some classic rock and see where the day takes us."
